info.title: Pick and Pack API
info.description:
The Pick and Pack API provides comprehensive functionality for order management, picking operations, shipment tracking, and returns processing. The main capabilities include:

- Retrieving detailed order information, including items, packages, and status
- Accessing worksheet data for picking operations
- Querying shipment tracking and delivery details
- Getting facility information

## Authentication

- `POST` [Generate JWT token](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/pick-and-pack-api#post-/token)

## Orders

- `GET` [Get order by ID](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/pick-and-pack-api#get-/orders/-orderId-)
- `PATCH` [Set order delivery](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/pick-and-pack-api#patch-/orders/-orderId-/tracking)

## Worksheets

- `GET` [Get worksheet by ID](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/pick-and-pack-api#get-/worksheets/-worksheetId-)
- `GET` [Get worksheets by order ID](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/pick-and-pack-api#get-/worksheets)

## Facilities

- `GET` [Get facility by ID](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/pick-and-pack-api#get-/facilities/-facilityId-)

## Shipments

- `GET` [Get shipment](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/pick-and-pack-api#get-/shipments/-shipmentId-)
- `GET` [List shipments](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/pick-and-pack-api#get-/shipments/-orderId-)

## Common issues and solutions

In case of errors making a request, check the list of common issues and their solutions below.

### 1. Token expiration

- Authentication token expires after 15 minutes.  
- Check console logs for refresh attempt.  
- Verify `APIKEY_ACCOUNT` format.  
- Ensure that endpoint URLs are correct.  

### 2. Variable errors

- Check variable syntax.  
- Validate API key format.  

### 3. Cache-related issues

- Response data might appear stale due to API caching.  
- Endpoints have a specific cache duration of 30 seconds.  
- For real-time data, consider the cache duration when implementing polling strategies.  
- Cache is based on specific parameters (e.g., `orderId`, `shipmentId`).

servers.description: Server to access the authentication necessary to make a request in the Pick and Pack API.
Server to access the Pick and Pack API.

post.description:
Generates a `JWT` (JSON Web Token) necessary to access the Pick and Pack API information. To generate the `JWT` it's necessary to have the `API KEY`. To obtain this information, access **VTEX Admin > Shipping > Pick and Pack > Settings > Integration > API Key**.

>ℹ️ The authentication token expires after 15 minutes.

## Permissions

This endpoint does not require [permissions](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3).

apiKey.description: The `API KEY` generated in **VTEX Admin > Shipping > Pick and Pack > Settings > Integration > API Key**.

servers.description: Server to access the authentication necessary to make a request in the Pick and Pack API.

get.description:
Retrieves order details by its ID.

>ℹ️ The response is cached for 30 seconds based on the `orderId` parameter. The endpoint supports up to 500 requests per second, with a maximum of 100 concurrent requests.

>ℹ️ [Generate a JWT token](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/pick-and-pack-api#post-/token) to endpoint authentication. JSON Web Token (JWT) is an open standard (RFC 7519) that defines a compact and self-contained way for securely transmitting information as a JSON object between parties. 

## Permissions

Any user must have at least one of the appropriate [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3) to be able to successfully run this request. Otherwise they will receive a status code `403` error. These are the applicable resources for this endpoint:

| **Product** | **Category** | **Resource** |
| --------------- | ----------------- | ----------------- |
| OMS | OMS access | **Change order** |
| OMS | OMS access | **View order** |

You can [create a custom role](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/roles--7HKK5Uau2H6wxE1rH5oRbc#creating-a-role) with that resource or use one of the following [predefined roles](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/predefined-roles--jGDurZKJHvHJS13LnO7Dy):

| **Role** | **Resource** | 
| --------------- | ----------------- | 
| OMS - Full access | Change order |
| OMS - Full access | View order |

>❗ Assigning a [predefined role](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/predefined-roles--jGDurZKJHvHJS13LnO7Dy) to users or application keys usually grants permission to multiple [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3). If some of these permissions are not necessary, consider creating a custom role instead. For more information regarding security, see [Best practices for using application keys](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/best-practices-application-keys--7b6nD1VMHa49aI5brlOvJm).

schema.description: Order with status, timing, items, packages, invoices, and payments.

orderId.description: Unique order identifier assigned by the platform.

createdAt.description: Order creation date and time  in ISO 8601 format.

updatedAt.description: Order last update date and time  in ISO 8601 format.

shippingEstimatedDateMin.description: Minimum estimated shipping date and time in ISO 8601 format.

tags.description: List of free-form tags associated with the order.

pickingTime.description: Time spent in picking stage, in minutes (decimal).

packingTime.description: Time spent in packing stage, in minutes (decimal).

shippingTime.description: Time spent in shipping stage, in minutes (decimal).

items.description: Invoice entry with key and total.

invoiceTotal.description: Total invoice amount in minor currency units.

unhandledItems.description: Order unhandled items, not yet processed to a final state.

originalQuantity.description: Quantity originally ordered before any adjustments.

replacedBy.description: List of unhandled item replaced by.

weighableProduct.description: Indicates if the product is sold by weight.

unitMultiplier.description: Unit multiplier applied to the item.

originalUnitMultiplier.description: Original unit multiplier before any changes.

unitOfMeasure.description: Unit of measure for the item.

items.description: Reason entry explaining an exception or change.

reasonDetail.description: Reason for the unhandled item, such as out-of-stock.

pickers.description: Identifiers of pickers who handled this line.

warehouses.description: List of warehouse allocation or availability for this item.

createdAt.description: Item created date and time in ISO 8601 timestamp.

originalQuantity.description: Quantity originally ordered before any adjustments.

replacedBy.description: List of picked item replaced by.

weighableProduct.description: Indicates if the product is sold by weight.

unitMultiplier.description: Unit multiplier applied to the item.

originalUnitMultiplier.description: Original unit multiplier before any changes.

unitOfMeasure.description: Unit of measure for the item (for example, KILOGRAMS or UNITS).

packedQuantity.description: Quantity packed for this picked item.

reasons.description: List of reasons for rejection or change.

items.description: Reason entry explaining an exception or change.

pickers.description: Identifiers of pickers who handled this line.

warehouses.description: List of warehouse allocation or availability for this item.

createdAt.description: Picked item creation date in ISO 8601 format.

rejectedItems.description: List of items that were rejected, for example due to being out-of-stock.

id.description: Rejected item identifier within the order.

quantity.description: Final quantity for this rejected item.

originalQuantity.description: Quantity originally ordered before any adjustments.

items.description: ID of the items that served as replacements for this one.

replacedBy.description: List of items that replaced the current item.

weighableProduct.description: Indicates if the product is sold by weight.

originalUnitMultiplier.description: Original unit multiplier before any changes.

unitOfMeasure.description: Unit of measure for the item.

items.description: URL of a rejected item image.

reasons.description: List of reasons for rejection or change.

items.description: Reason entry explaining an exception or change.

pickers.description: Identifiers of pickers who handled this item.

warehouses.description: List of warehouse allocation or availability for this item.

createdAt.description: Rejected item creation date in ISO 8601 format.

replacedItems.description: Items that replaced other items or were themselves replacements.

packages.description: List of packages created for the order.

itemsIds.description: List of identifiers of items included in this package.

items.description: Item ID contained in the package.

payment.description: List of payments linked to this order.

servers.description: Server to access the Pick and Pack API.

patch.description:
This endpoint finalizes the Pick and Pack workflow by marking the order as delivered. Additionally, it allows you to update the OMS with shipping details. All fields are optional. For more information, see [Update order tracking status](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/orders-api#put-/api/oms/pvt/orders/-orderId-/invoice/-invoiceNumber-/tracking) endpoint.

>ℹ️ [Generate a JWT token](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/pick-and-pack-api#post-/token) to endpoint authentication. JSON Web Token (JWT) is an open standard (RFC 7519) that defines a compact and self-contained way for securely transmitting information as a JSON object between parties. 

## Permissions

Any user must have at least one of the appropriate [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3) to be able to successfully run this request. Otherwise they will receive a status code `403` error. These are the applicable resources for this endpoint:

| **Product** | **Category** | **Resource** |
| --------------- | ----------------- | ----------------- |
| OMS | OMS access | **Change order** |
| OMS | OMS access | **View order** |

You can [create a custom role](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/roles--7HKK5Uau2H6wxE1rH5oRbc#creating-a-role) with that resource or use one of the following [predefined roles](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/predefined-roles--jGDurZKJHvHJS13LnO7Dy):

| **Role** | **Resource** | 
| --------------- | ----------------- | 
| OMS - Full access | Change order |
| OMS - Full access | View order |

>❗ Assigning a [predefined role](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/predefined-roles--jGDurZKJHvHJS13LnO7Dy) to users or application keys usually grants permission to multiple [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3). If some of these permissions are not necessary, consider creating a custom role instead. For more information regarding security, see [Best practices for using application keys](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/best-practices-application-keys--7b6nD1VMHa49aI5brlOvJm).

deliveredDate.description: Date and time when the order was delivered.

events.description: List of events that occurred during the delivery process.

date.description: Date and time when the event occurred.

example.message: The order must be invoiced to update the status to delivered

servers.description: Server to access the Pick and Pack API.

get.description:
Retrieves detailed information about a shipment using either the internal system ID or the carrier's tracking ID.

>ℹ️ The response is cached for 30 seconds based on the `shipmentId` parameter and `X-PNP-FilterMethod` header. The endpoint supports up to 500 requests per second, with a maximum of 100 concurrent requests.

>ℹ️ [Generate a JWT token](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/pick-and-pack-api#post-/token) to endpoint authentication. JSON Web Token (JWT) is an open standard (RFC 7519) that defines a compact and self-contained way for securely transmitting information as a JSON object between parties. 

## Permissions

Any user must have at least one of the appropriate [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3) to be able to successfully run this request. Otherwise they will receive a status code `403` error. These are the applicable resources for this endpoint:

| **Product** | **Category** | **Resource** |
| --------------- | ----------------- | ----------------- |
| OMS | OMS access | **Change order** |
| OMS | OMS access | **View order** |

You can [create a custom role](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/roles--7HKK5Uau2H6wxE1rH5oRbc#creating-a-role) with that resource or use one of the following [predefined roles](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/predefined-roles--jGDurZKJHvHJS13LnO7Dy):

| **Role** | **Resource** | 
| --------------- | ----------------- | 
| OMS - Full access | Change order |
| OMS - Full access | View order |

>❗ Assigning a [predefined role](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/predefined-roles--jGDurZKJHvHJS13LnO7Dy) to users or application keys usually grants permission to multiple [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3). If some of these permissions are not necessary, consider creating a custom role instead. For more information regarding security, see [Best practices for using application keys](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/best-practices-application-keys--7b6nD1VMHa49aI5brlOvJm).

parameters.name: shipmentId
parameters.description: Shipment ID. Its value depends on the `X-PNP-FilterMethod` header. Use internal UUID when using `BY_INTERNAL_ID` filter or carrier tracking number when using `BY_EXTERNAL_ID` filter.

parameters.name: X-PNP-FilterMethod
parameters.description: Determines how the `shipmentId` will be interpreted. Its values can be `BY_INTERNAL_ID` or `BY_EXTERNAL_ID`.

example.message: You do not have access to this shipment [da6c9988-7659-4cbd-bee3-5b44309eae07]

Authorization.description: Authentication JWT created by the [Generate JWT token](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/pick-and-pack-api#post-/token?endpoint=post-/token). JSON Web Token (JWT) is an open standard (RFC 7519) that defines a compact and self-contained way for securely transmitting information as a JSON object between parties.
